result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence A Buchanan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrence A Buchanan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terrence A Buchanan was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant wishes to proceed pro se, CT questions his waiver.  Defendant asks for 30 day setover to be able to research his defense.  CT grants setover and sets PH date.  No further setovers will be granted.

Def is unrepresented and wishes to represent himself on this case.  CT makes a record of def's waiver of counsel.  CT finds good cause and resets for PH.  CT will contact SPD to have them interview def so that he can make an informed decision to proceed in case pro se.
